item.title: HELE
item.description: Article goes here. For other options, put these in the front matter: description: “A description” other than the blog intro draft: true to not publish article yet showDate: true/false to enable/disable showing dates math: true to enable showing equations (katex) chordsheet: true to add chordsheet styelsheet lastmod: 2020-4-11 after modifying an article, set lastmod to let google know that you have updated the article (SEO)

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Placeholder Text
item.description: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Features of Ramium
item.description: Ramium is Packed with awesome features that makes your blog powerful and easy to use.

item.title: About Ramium
item.description: Ramium is an awesome hugo theme for creating personal blogs. Apparently, none of the existing hugo themes were what I wanted them to be for my new blog. Or maybe I just could not find the right one. So I took upon the courtesy of making the perfect one for my own.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this:
